title.narrative: USAID Partnership for Education: Learning II

description.narrative: (Ghana): USAID will continue to leverage Ghanaian leadership,whose expertise, and international best practices to train primary school teachers to deliver a comprehensive phonics-based reading approach and innovative math practices in all 11 national languages of instruction. Assistance enhances the Ministry of Education's teacher supervision capacity to ensure adequate time-on-task is provided to improve learning in reading and math, strengthen oversight, revise reading and numeracy curricula, and formulate policy. Ghana recently developed a National Education Sector Plan for 2018-2030 with the aim of improving learning outcomes, equity and accountability. With Fiscal Year 2018 funds, USAID will work with the Ministry to transition reading management to the Ministry's units, and design a school accountability framework that improves supervision, time-on-task, and learning. USAID will advance the design of a "transition to English" approach that helps students develop skills in English by primary grade 3 to ensure a smoother transition to all English-content primary grade 4. Improving learning outcomes in the basic skill areas is critical for improving learning and preparing students for academic success. Proficient reading and math skills are required for a population that can contribute to robust economic and social development, peace, and prosperity. . .
